commands.name: Step 1: Create Namespace
commands.command: kubectl create namespace scenarios --dry-run=client -o yaml | kubectl apply -f -

commands.name: Step 2: Deploy StatefulSet
commands.description: Deploy StatefulSet with 3 replicas and PVCs
commands.explanation: Creates headless service and StatefulSet. Each pod gets a stable name (nginx-sts-0, nginx-sts-1, nginx-sts-2) and its own PersistentVolumeClaim. Pods are created sequentially (ordered).

commands.name: Step 3: Watch Ordered Creation
commands.explanation: Pods create in order: nginx-sts-0 must be Running before nginx-sts-1 starts, and so on. This ordered startup is a StatefulSet guarantee. Press Ctrl+C when all 3 are Running.

commands.name: Step 4: List Pods with IPs
commands.command: kubectl get pods -n scenarios -l app=nginx-sts -o wide
commands.description: See stable pod names and IPs
commands.explanation: Pod names are predictable: nginx-sts-0, nginx-sts-1, nginx-sts-2. These names never change, even if pods are deleted and recreated.
commands.what_it_does: Lists pods with their stable identities.

commands.name: Step 5: List PVCs
commands.explanation: Each pod has its own PVC: data-nginx-sts-0, data-nginx-sts-1, data-nginx-sts-2. These persist even if pods are deleted. Storage survives pod lifecycle.
commands.what_it_does: Lists all PVCs with their status and capacity.

commands.name: Step 6: Write Test Data
commands.command: kubectl exec nginx-sts-0 -n scenarios -- sh -c 'echo "Hello from nginx-sts-0" > /usr/share/nginx/html/data.txt'
commands.description: Write file to pod-0's persistent storage
commands.explanation: Creates a file in the mounted volume. This data is stored in the PVC, not the pod filesystem. It will survive pod deletion.
commands.what_it_does: Creates test file in persistent volume.
commands.next_step: Delete pod to test data persistence.

commands.name: Step 7: Delete Pod-0
commands.description: Delete pod to test recreation with same identity
commands.explanation: StatefulSet immediately recreates nginx-sts-0 (same name) and reattaches the same PVC. Data survives because it's in the PVC, not the pod.
commands.what_it_does: Triggers pod deletion and automatic recreation.

commands.name: Step 8: Wait for Recreation
commands.description: Wait for new nginx-sts-0 to be Ready
commands.explanation: Waits up to 60s for the recreated pod to be Ready. Same name, same PVC, data preserved.
commands.what_it_does: Blocks until pod is Ready or timeout.

commands.name: Step 9: Verify Data Persisted
commands.description: Read test file from recreated pod
commands.explanation: Should show 'Hello from nginx-sts-0'. Data survived pod deletion because the PVC was reattached to the new pod. This is StatefulSet's stable storage guarantee.

commands.name: Step 10: Scale Down
commands.explanation: StatefulSet scales down in reverse order: nginx-sts-2 deleted, then nginx-sts-1. PVCs are retained (not deleted) to preserve data.

commands.name: Step 11: Scale Up
commands.explanation: Pods nginx-sts-1 and nginx-sts-2 are recreated and reattach their original PVCs. Any data written before scale-down is still there.

commands.name: Cleanup: Delete StatefulSet
commands.explanation: Deletes StatefulSet and pods, but PVCs persist by design. You must manually delete PVCs to free storage.

commands.name: Cleanup: Delete PVCs
commands.explanation: Deletes all PVCs created by the StatefulSet. This frees storage but data is lost.
